Method and System for Adaptive Modular Actuation in Multi-stage Mechanisms
The present disclosure relates generally to actuation systems for mechanical devices, and more particularly to adaptive, modular actuation assemblies for multi-stage mechanisms that autonomously adjust force distribution and timing to optimize performance under variable load and environmental conditions.
Conventional multi-stage actuation systems often rely on fixed gearing ratios and predetermined timing sequences, which can result in suboptimal efficiency and increased wear when operating under differing loads or when components age, and because many systems cannot adapt their dynamics while in operation, they require manual recalibration or replacement of parts, which increases downtime and maintenance costs.
